alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha, southeastern Roane and southwestern Clay Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elkview, or 7 miles northeast of Charleston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Clay, Sissonville, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Clendenin, Pinch, Glen, Coal Fork, Elkview, Amma, Bickmore, Tariff, Procious, Indore and Left Hand. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 113. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 89 and 95. Route 119 near mile marker 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
